Data: Rampaul to Ponting, no run short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover-point
Rampaul to Ponting, no run full, on off, driven to mid-on
Rampaul to Ponting, no run length ball on off, driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
Rampaul to Ponting, no run length ball outside off, Ponting leaves it alone. The ball swings in, Ponting has the stumps covered, but it hasn't done enough to hit the pad
Rampaul to Ponting, no run Ponting plays at this one, probably with the previous delivery in mind. This one moves in, but not as much as the previous one, and his outside edge is beaten

Rampaul to Ponting, no run short of a length, well outside off, Ponting gets back and across, gets an inside edge onto the pad. Rampaul appeals for the lbw, but he even if he hadn't edged it, this would have been outside the line
Shilling to Clarke, no run shimmies down the track, turns this to midwicket, but Deonarine makes sure Clarke stays on strike
Shilling to Clarke, 1 run no mid-on - you've got to be kidding me. Clarke has pushed an easy single to long-on to get away from Shilly
Shilling to Ponting, 1 run flighted outside off, Ponting pushes at it, doesn't get all of it, but pushes it past silly point, and there is no cover
Shilling to Clarke, no run short of a length, and this jumps and bites, Clarke's bottom hand is off, but the ball hits him in the rib cage
Shilling to Clarke, no run flighted outside off, Clarke pushes forward and uses the pad as the first line of defence

Shilling to Clarke, no run What does Shilly need to do to get a wicket here?. More bite, more turn, more bounce, towards Clarke's rib cage. Off the glove it goes, but square, and well wide of forward short leg. Shilly can't believe it
Rampaul to Ponting, no run full outside off, holding its line, left alone
Rampaul to Ponting, 1 run short of a length, just outside off, and this one actually moves away. Pushed square, past point for a single
Rampaul to Clarke, no run bouncer, too short, too far outside off. Clarke ducks
Rampaul to Clarke, 2 runs short of a length, outside off, short-arm-pulled wide of deep midwicket
Rampaul to Clarke, no run short of a length, and Clarke tries the pull again. This time he is caught playing too high, but the inside-edge only finds his pad. Another near wicket
Rampaul to Clarke, no run fuller, middle and work, worked away, but can't beat midwicket
Shilling to Ponting, 1 run full on off, pushed to long-on. Can't be giving them such easy singles. Beats me
Shilling to Clarke, 1 run Clarke shimmies down to turn this fullish ball past midwicket to get off strike again
Shilling to Ponting, no run flighted outside off, Ponting lunges forward to push this to straight short extra cover
Shilling to Ponting, no run quicker, flatter offbreak, Ponting turns this to leg gully, on the bounce
Shilling to Ponting, no run toppie, but too full, and Ponting is right to its pitch, and then it doesn't matter how it is turning
Shilling to Ponting, no run quick offbreak, more extra bounce. Ponting is forward and does well to keep it down
Rampaul to Clarke, no run dangerous leave. This would have hit the fifth stump. Length ball, not too wide, and shoulders arms without covering the off stump. The ball moves back in, but not enough
Rampaul to Clarke, no run short of a length, punched away to point
Rampaul to Clarke, no run shaping in towards middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
Rampaul to Clarke, no run length ball, headed for top of off, defended off the front foot
Rampaul to Clarke, 2 runs late-cuts this, Brathwaite gets a hand to it at point, but they get two
Rampaul to Clarke, no run goes wide of the crease, length ball outside off, left alone
Shilling to Ponting, 2 runs short, wide, despite the turn back in Ponting manages to punch it through the expanses on the off side
Shilling to Ponting, no run short of a lenght, stays back to cover the bounce, and defends
Shilling to Ponting, 1 run full on the pads, and pushed for an easy, annoying single to long-on
Shilling to Clarke, no run turning sharply into the pads, pushed between the two short legs
Shilling to Clarke, no run flighted well outside off, Clarke well forward to defend. In fact he leaves the crease too
Shilling to Clarke, 2 runs flat, outside off, punched against the turn, and there are enough open spaces on the off side

Paul pointed out that England's Phil DeFreitas was also born in Dominica.
Join us at 12.35. Alex will take you through the first hour.

Another example of Australia's fighting spirit. There were a few hoicks and cuts that were missed so it wasn't flawless. But credit to Hilfenhaus for sticking it out. Without him, Wade wouldn't have reached his century.

Lunch: So West Indies just about sneak in the last two wickets before lunch. They really should have done a lot better and the inability to finish things off will be addressed before they leave for England.
Shillingford's dad proudly watches his son lead the team off the field
Bravo walks in. 2 slips in place

Nathan Lyon, whom the left handers played far easier, also opening up...
